text: those are two great things to take part in - you're right that those skills will be useful. Well done on taking the opportunity!
What experiences best prepared you for your job?
probably sailing - i got qualifications for being in charge of a yacht, and that taught me how to manage groups in tough situations that makes managing people in an office very easy!
Hahaha wow thats amazing.. It must be very fun :joy::joy::smiley::smiley::grinning::smiley:

it is quite a specialist way to get skills! in terms of more every day things, probably the best experience is reading - a lot of my job is reading other peoples reports and having to understand them fully very quickly. So reading fiction, non fiction, whatever really, helps me get used to thinking about different things. Obviously that's not going to be true for every job, but certainly for me

Mhm I think reading benefits everyone. For example I read a study which investigated whether Reading has any influence on a student in terms of their mathematical and problem solving skills. And that proved to be so. The more you read the more you get better at math and solving problems. And just like you said - the study concluded that reading allows you to be able to thing different ways giving you different prespectives to approach a problem hence students who read more perform better in their subjects than their other non-reading peers.
I read alot.. I like reading. Thats why I chose english literature. :D
That sounds interesting, would be interested to see that study.
What sort of things do you like to read?

I think I'd classify reading as my hobby. When I go outside I often find myself reading things. for example - A leftover leaflet on a vacant bus seat - I would just grab it and start reading ( I often miss my bus-stop because of this habit). 

If Im In a crowd or if Im In a place where I need to line up to get something I would look to see if there are any published articles or posters around me like on the walls and stuff and start reading them. 

However there are things that I read which I actually enjoy and not read them just out of habit. For example; currently Im reading 'The Great Gatsby' my english teacher reccommended it to me as it is a book where I can practice lots of analysing techniques. 

Like I mentioned in my introduction I also spend some of my time writing stories and then drawing the characters I've created.

I enjoy fictional stories the most, the Wild and amazing concepts people come up with make the entire story so fun and enjoyable. I also read Manga which are japaneese comics - they are also very fun to read.
